N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6026.3 - Minimum standards for approval of a pre-employment police basic training course

State Regulations
(a) A pre-employment police basic training
course must be approved by the commissioner pursuant to this Part prior to
being conducted, and shall be conducted only at an approved pre-employment
police training school. (b) A
pre-employment police basic training course shall follow the basic course for
police officers curriculum as set forth in Part 6020 of this Title, with the
exception of the units determined by the council that shall not be presented to
civilians. If a civilian completes one or more of the excepted categories, credit for such completion shall not be awarded toward the basic course for
police officers set forth in Part 6020 of this Title. (c) Specific time allotment for the
categories and respective titles and topics shall meet or exceed those
established by the council and published by the commissioner for the basic
course for police officers as set forth in Part 6020 of this Title. (d) Only instructors certified in accordance
with the provisions of Parts 6023 and/or 6024 of this Title may provide
instruction in a pre-employment police basic training course. (e) Only course directors as defined in
section
6026.1
(e) may
administer a pre-employment police basic training course. (f) Only individuals who are citizens of the

United States or lawfully residing within the United States, who possess a high
school diploma or general education diploma, and who have not been convicted of
a felony or convicted of an offense in another jurisdiction that would
constitute a felony in the State of New York may attend a pre-employment police
basic training course. Notes
